SourceText: üíö That's OK! Sometimes, things take time. You can review this lesson in the Main Menu at any time. At the end of the day, think of all of the positive things that happened - this makes it easier to point them out. ‚òÄÔ∏è With time, it will become easier for you to praise your child.

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER} spends one-on-one time with her granddaughter, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}, as part of her bedtime routine. Let‚Äôs see how they do it together!
text: U-{F2_GRANDMOTHER} uchitha isikhathi esibalulekile bodwa nomzukulu wakhe {F2_DAUGHTER_3}  njengengxenye yohlelo lwakhe lokulala. Ake sibone ukuthi bakwenza kanjani ndawonye!

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúI am so happy to see you playing quietly with your blocks, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. When I come back, it will be time to get ready for bed. When you are ready for bed, we can have 5 minutes of one-on-one time together.‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}}**: ‚ÄúNgijabule kakhulu ukukubona udlala ngokuthula ngamabhuloksi akho, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. Uma ngibuya, kuzobe sekuyisikhathi sokulungela ukulala. Uma usulungele ukulala, singaba nemizuzu engu-5 yesikhathi sethu sokuba sobabili sodwa.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: ‚ÄúOkay!‚Äù
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: ‚ÄúKulungile!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúTime to get ready for bed, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. First, let‚Äôs get you nice and clean with a bath.‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúSekuyisikhathi sokulungela ukulala, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. Okokuqala, ake sikugeze.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúYou were so well-behaved in the bath, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. Now it is time to put your pyjamas on.‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúUbuziphethe kahle ebhavini, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. Manje sekuyisikhathi sokugqoka izingubo zokulala.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúWell done for putting on your pyjamas by yourself, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}! Now let‚Äôs brush your teeth. Make sure you get the ones in the back of your mouth too!‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúWenze kahle ngokuzigqokisa izingubo zakho zokulala, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}! Manje ake sixubhe amazinyo akho. Qiniseka ukuthi uyawenza nalawo angemuva emlonyeni!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúYou did so well getting ready for bed! Now, we have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spend together. What would you like to do?‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúWenze kahle kakhulu ngokulungiselela ukulala! Manje, sinemizuzu engu-5 yesikhathi sisodwa sobabili esingasichitha ndawonye. Ungathanda ukwenzani?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: ‚ÄúYay! Can you read me my favourite story?‚Äù
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: ‚ÄúYa! Ungakwazi ukungifundela indaba engiyithandayo?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚Äú ‚ÄúThe end‚Ä¶.‚Äù Such a lovely story! Goodnight, my baby girl. I love you very much.‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}}**: ‚ÄúYaphela‚Ä¶.‚Äù Yaze yamnandi! Ulale kahle, ntombazane yami. Ngikuthanda kakhulu."

SourceText: üí° Learn about different emotions. There are 6 basic emotions that each send us a very specific message:
text: üí° Funda mayelana nemizwa ehlukahlukene. Kunemizwa engu-6 eyisisekelo ngayinye esithumelela umlayezo othize:

SourceText: üòÉHappy: Keep doing things that make you feel good.
text: üòÉInjabulo: Qhubeka wenza izinto ezikwenza uzizwe kamnandi.

SourceText: üòîSad: Something important in your life needs attention.
text: üòîUkudangala: Kukhona okubalulekile empilweni yakho okudinga ukunakwa.

SourceText: üî¥Angry: Stand up for ourselves and set limits.
text: üî¥Ukuthukuthela: Asizimele futhi sibeke imingcele.

SourceText: üò£Disgusted: Move away from what we don't like.
text: üò£Ukwesaba: Suka kulokho ongakuthandi.

SourceText: üëÄSurprised: Stop and pay attention for a moment.
text: üëÄUkumangela: Yima unake isikhashana.

SourceText: üö©Afraid: Run away from danger.
text: üö©Ukwesaba: Balekela ingozini.

SourceText: This lesson is about how we can stay calm and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments with our children. üíö

SourceText: üå∑ We love our children, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us feel angry. This is a normal part of life!
text: üå∑ Siyazithanda izingane zethu, kodwa ukukhathazeka ngenxa yokuba ngumnakekeli nokunye kungasenza sithukuthele! Lokhu kuyinxenye yempilo ejwayelekile!

SourceText: üí° It is important for us to try to stay calm in order to help manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
text: üí° Kubalulekile ukuthi silawule intukuthelo yethu ukuze singabalimazi abanye.

SourceText: When I am angry at my child, I should show that I am angry so they stop misbehaving.
text: Uma ngiyithukuthelele ingane yami, kufanele ngiyitshengise ukuthi ngicasukile ukuze iyeke ukuhlupha.

SourceText: üíõ It can be very difficult when your child is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your anger before doing anything.
text: üíõ Kungaba nzima uma ingane yakho ihlupha, kodwa kufanele uzame ukulawula ukukhathazeka kwakho ulawule intukuthelo yakho ngaphambi kokwenza into ethile.

SourceText: üå± Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
text: üå± Ukudonsa umoya kuzosiza. Ukuthukuthela kungakweza usho noma wenza izinto ozozisola ngazo kamuva.

SourceText: üéâ That‚Äôs correct!

SourceText: True or False: When I spend special time with my teen, I need to decide what we will do together.
text: Iqiniso Noma Amanga: Lapho ngichitha isikhathi esikhethekile nomntwana wami osemusha, kudingeka nginqume ukuthi yini esizoyenza ndawonye.

SourceText: üëÄ Oops! That‚Äôs not actually true.
text: üëÄAw! Akusilo iqiniso.

SourceText: üö≤ You do not have to plan an activity. Your teen can lead! Let them choose as long as it is safe. This will increase their confidence and make it more likely that they enjoy their time with you.
text: üö≤ Akudingeki uhlele into enizoyenza. Umntwana wakho osemusha angahola! Mvumele akhete enizokwenza inqobo nje uma kuphephile. Lokhu kuzokwandisa ukuzethemba kwakhe futhi kwenze kube lula ukuthi asijabulele isikhathi sakhe enawe.

SourceText: Let‚Äôs see how {F1_FATHER} and {F1_DAUGHTER_13} spend one-on-one time together:
text: Masibone ukuthi u{F1_FATHER} no{F1_DAUGHTER_13} bachitha kanjani isikhathi bebobabili bodwa:

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚Äú{F1_DAUGHTER_13}, how was your day?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: {F1_DAUGHTER_13}, belunjani usuku lwakho?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúMy day was good, {F1_FATHER}. I just came from school.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúUsuku lwami beluluhle, {F1_FATHER}. Ngisanda kubuya esikoleni.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúI have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spare before I have to drive to work again. What would you like to do together?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Nginemizuzu engu-5 yesikhathi sokuba nawe sisobabili ngaphambi kokuphindela emsebenzini. Yini ongathanda ukuthi siyenze ndawonye?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúI was about to do my Science homework. The topic for the homework is to make something out of recycled materials. Could you please help me with it?‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}: Besengizoqala ukwenza umsebenzi wami wesikole wasekhaya weSayensi. Isihloko somsebenzi wukwenza into ethile ngokusebenzisa izinto ezilahliwe. Bengicela ungisiza ngawo?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúI would be happy to!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúNgingakujabulela ukukusiza!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúI thought of building a recycled house using old bottles, boxes, and other recycled materials. Look! I picked these up on my way home. They were thrown away by the side of the road and outside the spaza shops.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúNgicabange ukwakha indlu ngamabhodlela amadala, amabhokisi nezinye izinto ezigaywe kabusha. Buka! Ngizicoshe endleleni sengibuyela ekhaya. Bezilahlwe eceleni komgwaqo nangaphandle kwezitolo.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúWhat a good idea, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}! Sounds like you‚Äôve thought about this a lot and want to put a lot of effort into your homework. How do you want me to help you?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Awu lowo umbono omuhle, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}! Kuzwakala sengathi ukucabangisisile lokhu futhi ufuna ukuwenza ngempela lomsebenzi wesikole wasekhaya. Mina ufuna ngikusize kanjani?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúCould you help me clean these bottles? They will be the pillars of the house. I will make the boxes into the walls and roof of the house. Later, I thought we could paint the boxes and bottles so they look beautiful.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}: Baba, ngicela ungisiza ungigezela lawa mabhodlela. Azoba yizinsika zendlu. Amabhokisi azoba yizindonga nophahla lwendlu. Emva kwalokho, bengicabanga ukuthi sipende amabhokisi namabhodlela ukuze kuzoba kuhle.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúI may have some leftover paint outside the house. I can take a look later.‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Ngiyacabanga ukuthi kukhona upende osele ngaphandle, ngizoyobheka emva kwesikhashana.‚Äù

SourceText: (Later in the day)
text: (Emva kwethuba ngalolosuku)

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúWow, it looks different now! It does not look like you used rubbish at all anymore. You also painted the walls and the roof beautifully! I think your teacher will be proud of you when she sees your homework!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Wawu, ibukeka ihlukile manje! Ngeke uze ucabange ukuthi yenziwe ngodoti. Uphinde wapenda nezindonga nophahla kahle! Ngicabanga ukuthi uthishelakazi wakho uzoziqhenya ngawe uma esebone umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúThank you for your help, {F1_FATHER}. You know, there were a lot of fun things that happened in school today.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: Ngiyabonga ngosizo lwakho, {F1_FATHER}. Uyazi, kwenzeke izinto eziningi ezijabulisayo esikoleni namuhla.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúGo ahead, tell me!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúKwenzekeni, ngixoxele!‚Äù

SourceText: Here is a comic about how you can talk about feelings with your teen during one-on-one time.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} and {F1_DAUGHTER_16} are spending one-on-one time by taking a walk together. {F1_DAUGHTER_16} looks very upset.
text: U{F1_FATHER} kanye no{F1_DAUGHTER_16} bachitha isikhathi esisodwa ngokuthatha uhambo ndawonye. {F1_DAUGHTER_16} ubukeka ephatheke kabi.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚Äú{F1_DAUGHTER_16}, I noticed you have less energy today and you look sad. Do you want to talk about it?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚Äú{F1_DAUGHTER_16}, ngiqaphele ukuthi awunamndlandla namuhla futhi ubukeka udangele. Uyafuna ukukhuluma ngakho?"

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúOh, {F1_FATHER}. I studied so hard for my maths test and failed. I feel so sad and frustrated.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúMhh, {F1_FATHER}. Ngifunde kanzima ukuze ngibhale izivivinyo zezibalo ngifeyilile. Ngidabukile futhi ngikhungathekile.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúThat is frustrating, my girl. I know how hard you studied. Maybe we can come up with a new plan to help you with maths. Should we ask your teacher for extra help? Would you like me to talk to her or do you want to do it?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}*: ‚ÄúKuyakhathaza lokho, ntombazane yami. Ngiyazi ukuthi ufunde kanzima kangakanani. Mhlawumbe singaqhamuka nesu elisha lokukusiza ngezibalo. Ingabe kufanele sicele usizo olwengeziwe kuthisha wakho? Ungathanda ngikhulume naye noma ufuna ukuzicelela?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúThank you, {F1_FATHER}. I can do it! I think that might be a good idea.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúNgiyabonga, {F1_FATHER}. Ngingakwazi ukuyenza! Ngicabanga ukuthi lokho kungaba umqondo omuhle.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúYou know, maths may be difficult for you, but I am so proud of you for studying so hard, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}. Other people might give up, but you keep trying. That will help you so much in life!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúUyazi, i-maths ingase ibe nzima kuwe, kodwa ngiyaziqhenya ngawe ngokuzimisela kangaka ufunda, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}. Abanye abantu bangase bayeke, kodwa wena uyaqhubeka uzama. Lokho kuzokusiza kakhulu empilweni!‚Äù

SourceText: üíõ Accept how you and your teen feel. Remember, your body and their body are sending messages about what you both are feeling, and those messages are important.

SourceText: ‚≠ê Do some active exercise to shake out anger, give each other some space, or take some deep breaths to calm down. These are some ways to deal with your emotions.

SourceText: This lesson is about how we can keep calm and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments with our teens. üíö
text: Lesi isifundo simayelana nokuthi singahlala kanjani sizolile futhi sehlise intukuthelo uma sibhekana nemizuzu esikhathazayo nabantwana bethu. üíö

SourceText: üå∑ We love our teens, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us feel angry. This is a normal part of life!
text: üå∑ Siyabathanda abantwana bethu abasebasha, kodwa ukukhathazeka ngenxa yokuba ngumnakekeli kungasenza sithukuthele! Lokhu kuyinxenye yempilo ejwayelekile!

SourceText: üí° It is important for us to stay in control and manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
text: üí° Kubalulekile ukuthi silawule intukuthelo yethu ukuze singabalimazi abanye.

SourceText: True or False: When I am angry at my teen, I should show that I am angry so that they stop misbehaving.
text: Yebo noma Cha: Uma ngthukuthelele umntwana wami, kufanele ngimutshengise intukuthelo yami ukuze ayeke ukuziphatha ngendlela engamukelekile.

SourceText: üíõ It can be very difficult when your teen is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your own anger before doing anything.
text: üíõ Kungaba nzima uma umntwana wakho umntwana eziphatha kabi, kodwa kufanele uzame ukuphatha ukukhathazeka kwakho nokulawula intukuthelo yakho ngaphambi kokwenza into ethile.

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER} is about to spend one-on-one time with {F2_SON_15} but finds the living room in a mess. She notices that this makes her feel angry.
text: {F2_GRANDMOTHER} usezochitha isikhathi eyedwa no{F2_SON_15} kodwa uthola igumbi lokuphumula lihliphikile. Uyabona ukuthi kumenza ezizwe ethukuthele.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}** (thinking): ‚ÄúI‚Äôm feeling really angry. I am tired and my body feels tense. I just want to shout at {F2_SON_15}‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}** (uyacabanga): ‚ÄúNgizizwa ngithukuthele ngempela. Ngikhathele futhi umzimba wami uqinile. Ngifuna ukuthethisa u{F2_SON_15}‚Äù

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}** (thinking): ‚ÄúI will Take a Pause and put on my favourite song.‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}** (uyacabanga): "Ngizothatha Ikhefu futhi ngidlale ingoma engiyithandayo."

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}** (thinking): ‚ÄúI am feeling a little better. I can think more clearly about what to do to support my teen.‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**(ecabanga) Ngizizwa ngingcono. Sengingacabanga kangcono ukuthi ngingenze njani ukweseka ingane yami.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚Äú{F2_SON_15}, well done for doing your homework. You might  feel tired now. Let's take a 5-minute break, and after that, we can quickly pick up the mess together.‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚Äú{F2_SON_15}, wenze kahle ngokwenza umsebenzi wakho wesikole. Kungenzeka uzizwe ukhathele manje. Masithathe ikhefu lemizuzu emi-5, bese emuva kwalokho, singasheshisa siqoqe ndawonye."

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúThank you for doing your part to keep the house clean, {F2_SON_15}! I‚Äôm so proud of you for helping. Oh! It is our one-on-one time. What would you like to do?‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: "Ngiyabonga ngokwenza ingxenye yakho ukugcina indlu ihlanzekile, {F2_SON_15}! Ngiyaziqhenya ngawe ngokusiza. Bandla! Sekuyisikhathi sethu sisobabili. Ungathanda ukwenza ini?"

SourceText: ‚≠ê Before you focus on supporting others, it‚Äôs important to take care of yourself.
text: ‚≠ê Ngaphambi kokuthi ugxile ekwesekeni abanye abantu, kubalulekile ukuzinakekela.

SourceText: üò£ Feeling stressed as your children grow up is normal. As your relationship with them changes, it‚Äôs important to handle this shift well, and that starts with self-care.
text: üò£ Ukuzizwa ukhathazekile ngezingane zakho njengoba zikhula, kujwayelekile. Njengoba ubudlelwano bakhe nabo bushintsha, kubalulekile ukuphatha lolushintsho kahle, futhi lokho kuqala ngokuzinakekela.

SourceText: üå± Self-care means doing things for yourself to reduce stress and make you feel better.
text: üå± Ukuzinakekela ukuzenzela izinto ukwehlisa ukukhathazeka futhi uzenze uzizwe kangcono.

SourceText: ‚è∞ Let‚Äôs learn a simple way to handle everyday stress: Taking a pause.
text: ‚è∞ Asifunde indlela elula yokubhekana nokukhathazeka kosuku: Ukuthatha ikhefu.

SourceText: ‚ôª We will use this skill frequently in future lessons, so it is important to learn it today!
text: ‚ôª Sizosebenzisa lelikhono kakhulu ezifundweni ezilandelayo, ngakho ke kubalulekile ukulifunda namhlanje!

SourceText: Taking a pause will help you manage stress and be more able to take care of others and yourself.üå±
text: Ukuthatha ikhefu kuzokusiza ukuthi ukulawula ukuphatheka kabi nokukhathazeka ukuze ukwazi ukuzinakekela wena nabanye.üå±

SourceText: ‚ñ∂Ô∏èPress Play to practise taking a pause together.
text: ‚ñ∂Ô∏èCindezela Dlala ukuphrakthiza ukuthatha ikhefu ndawonye.

SourceText: Try taking a pause whenever you feel angry, overwhelmed, stressed or worried. ‚è∞
text: Zama ukuthatha ikhefu uma uzizwa uthukuthele, usindelwa noma ukhathazekile. ‚è∞

SourceText: Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the ground beneath you can make a difference. You can also take a pause with your child or teen.
text: Nokudonsa umoya kancane noma ukuxhumana nomhlaba kungenza umehluko. Ungathatha ikhefu noMntwana wakho noma intsha.

SourceText: Try taking a pause on a daily basis, even if you are feeling calm. Doing this regularly will help your brain take a pause, even in challenging situations.
text: Zama ukuthatha ikhefu nsuku zonke, noma uzizwa uzolile. Ukwenza lokhu nsuku zonke kusiza umqondo wakho ukuthi uphumule nalapho uhlangabezana nezimo ezinzima.

SourceText: Well done! üéâ You have learnt the importance of caring for yourself and how to take a pause. ‚ú®
text: Wenze kahle! üéâ Usufunde ukubaleleka kokuzinakekela nokuthi ukhefu ulithatha kanjani. ‚ú®

SourceText: ‚è∏  Find a place where you can sit comfortably.

SourceText: ‚≠ê You can close your eyes if you want.

SourceText: üîÑ Repeat this 5 times.

SourceText: üîµ Notice where you feel tension in your body and try to let it go.
text: üîµ Naka lapho uzwa khona ukuqina emzimbeni wakho bese uzama ukuyeka.
